intro: Bidens prestinaria, commonly known as the yellow fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually bright yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Bidens prestinaria is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
